H0.text: Circulation is most likely the result of an organism being born with a genetic abnormality that was not present in any of its ancestors.

H1.text: Competition is the most likely cause of a genetic abnormality that an organism is born with but that was not present in any of its ancestors.

H2.text: Mutation is the most likely result of an organism being born with a genetic abnormality not present in any of its ancestors.

H3.text: Respiration is the most likely cause of an organism being born with a genetic abnormality that was not present in any of its ancestors.

A4.text: Mutation is the ultimate source of all genetic variation

A5.text: Overall, rates of de novo mutations are low compared to those of inherited mutations, which categorizes them as rare forms of genetic variation

A6.text: When mutations occur in de novo they can result in rare genetic disorders even for individuals who have no previous family history of the condition.

A7.text: A de novo mutation can arise in a sperm or egg cell and become a germline mutation, or after fertilization as a post-zygotic mutation that cannot be inherited by offspring.
